0: Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Aerial footage showed the extent of the bad weather NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A cold snap sweeping across East Asia has killed at least 85 people in Taiwan and stranded 60,000 tourists in South Korea. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Taiwanese media reported deaths from hypothermia and cardiac disease following a sudden drop in temperature over the weekend. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Meanwhile heavy snow forced the closure of the airport on the Korean holiday island of Jeju, cancelling flights. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The cold spell has also hit Hong Kong, southern China and Japan. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Image copyright AFP Image caption This highway in Guangdong province was closed because of heavy snow NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 'Sudden drop' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Many of those who died in Taiwan were elderly people living in northern regions such as Taipei and Taoyuan. Those areas accounted for 66 of the deaths. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Another 16 were confirmed dead in the southern city of Kaohsiung. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The temperature in Taipei city fell to a 44-year low of 4C (39F) on Sunday, and many homes in Taiwan lack central heating. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Many victims reportedly had heart trouble and shortness of breath. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "In our experience, it's not the actual temperature but the sudden drop that's too sudden for people's circulatory systems,'' said a city official quoted by AP news agency. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Image copyright Getty Images NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The risks in the cold NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Most excess winter deaths and illnesses are not caused by hypothermia or extremes of cold, but by heart and breathing problems. Frail elderly people are particularly at risk. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Cold weather makes your heart work harder to keep your body warm. It increases your heart rate and blood pressure and can cause changes to your blood that increase the risk of developing blood clots that may lead to heart attacks and strokes. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Low temperatures can make it harder to breathe and can make existing chest problems, such as asthma, worse. There is also more flu circulating during the winter. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR If you have reduced mobility, are 65 or over, or have a health condition such as heart or lung disease, experts say it is a good idea to heat your home to at least 18C. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A 56-year-old man surnamed Chen was found dead on the street Sunday morning, reported Focus Taiwan, but most of the victims in the city and its surrounding region, known as New Taipei City, were found indoors. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Authorities have warned people, especially senior citizens, to keep warm and stay out of the cold. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In South Korea, more than 500 domestic and international flights have been cancelled in Jeju as the island, known for balmy weather and beaches, saw -6C weather. The airport was due to reopen on Monday night. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Thousands of tourists were left stranded over the weekend. Yonhap news agency reported that local officials were scrambling to find transport and accommodation. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Image copyright EPA Image caption On Monday morning hundreds of passengers were still stranded in Jeju airport NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Image copyright AFP/Getty Images Image caption The airport was blanketed in snow over the weekend leading to flight cancellations NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In Hong Kong, residents shivered in 3C, the lowest temperature there in nearly 60 years. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Parts of Guangzhou and Shenzhen in southern China have also seen the rare appearance of snow, while the southern Japanese island of Okinawa has seen sleet for the first time ever, report Chinese and Japanese media. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption East Asia cold snap: Why is it freezing in the region? NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Snowstorms have hit large parts of Japan as well, with more than 600 domestic flights cancelled across the country on Sunday and Monday, reported NHK news. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR At least five people have died so far and more than 100 have been injured in Japan. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Temperatures have dropped in some parts of South East Asia as well, including Vietnam and Thailand. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In Bangkok, which rarely sees temperatures below 20C, temperatures dropped to around 16C on Sunday, while Vietnam saw the coldest weather in about two decades over the weekend, with Hanoi experiencing 6C.
